title: Team Data Vizards
text:
This is our project webpage.
Please stay tuned to follow our project activities.
This is our template.

Team Members

Şadiye Öztürk
Melike Nur Kutlusan
Zeynep Tuncaboylu
Beyzanur Nas
Duygu Eken
Melek Er



Project Topic
We will carry out our project by considering 2021 internal migration data across Türkiye. Our main focus is In Migration of internal cities. In this regard, migration trends between different regions such as Eastern Anatolia, Southeastern Anatolia, Aegean, Marmara will be determined and migration relations between big cities and other cities will be analyzed in detail. The relationship between population density and migration will be determined by examining migration rates, especially in cities with large populations. Migration trends will be evaluated according to age groups, gender, educational status and reasons for migration. (retirement, appointment, etc.) Also, the economic development level of the economic region will be interpreted according to the labor force, household disposable income, number of enterprises, number of housing sales, etc. This comprehensive analysis will guide our project in understanding Turkey’s migration situation.


Data Set

title: Data
text:
Data source: xxx <a href=““C:-fall2023-team-data_vizards”” download>Population Data (İndir)

library(readxl)

population <-read_excel("~/DataVizards_FinalDataFrame.xlsx")

population

# A tibble: 81 × 31
      ID City         `Region ID` Regions `Toplam Nüfus`   Male Female `0-4 Yaş`
   <dbl> <chr>        <chr>       <chr>            <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>
 1     1 Adana        A           Akdeni…        2263373 1.13e6 1.13e6    165518
 2     2 Adıyaman     GD          Güneyd…         447227 2.24e5 2.23e5     43532
 3     3 Afyonkarahi… E           Ege Bö…         453835 2.26e5 2.28e5     30685
 4     4 Ağrı         D           Doğu A…         309256 1.58e5 1.51e5     34398
 5     5 Amasya       K           Karade…         247980 1.23e5 1.25e5     14770
 6     6 Ankara       I           İç Ana…        5747325 2.84e6 2.90e6    349381
 7     7 Antalya      A           Akdeni…        2619832 1.31e6 1.31e6    162718
 8     8 Artvin       K           Karade…         108181 5.46e4 5.36e4      6902
 9     9 Aydın        E           Ege Bö…        1134031 5.63e5 5.71e5     64764
10    10 Balıkesir    M           Marmar…        1250610 6.26e5 6.25e5     61415
# ℹ 71 more rows
# ℹ 23 more variables: `5-9 Yaş` <dbl>, `10-14 Yaş` <dbl>, `15-19 Yaş` <dbl>,
#   `20-24 Yaş` <dbl>, `25-29 Yaş` <dbl>, `30-34 Yaş` <dbl>, `35-39 Yaş` <dbl>,
#   `40-44 Yaş` <dbl>, `Diğer Yaş` <dbl>, Bilinmeyen <dbl>, Doktora <dbl>,
#   İlköğretim <dbl>, İlkokul <dbl>, Lise <dbl>,
#   `Okuma Yazma Bilen Fakat Bir Okul Bitirmeyen` <dbl>,
#   `Okuma Yazma Bilmeyen` <dbl>, Ortaokul <dbl>, `Yüksek Lisans` <dbl>, …

region26 <- read_excel("~/DataVizards_FinalDataFrame.xlsx", sheet = "26 Bölge")
region26

# A tibble: 26 × 5
   Bölge                      `Bölge 2 İd` `15+ İşgücü(Bin)` `15-64 İşgücü(Bin)`
   <chr>                      <chr>                    <dbl>               <dbl>
 1 Adana, Mersin              TR62                      1579                1528
 2 Ağrı, Kars, Iğdır, Ardahan TRA2                       383                 369
 3 Ankara                     TR51                      2341                2308
 4 Antalya, Isparta, Burdur   TR61                      1425                1380
 5 Aydın, Denizli, Muğla      TR32                      1349                1296
 6 Balıkesir, Çanakkale       TR22                       718                 687
 7 Bursa, Eskişehir, Bilecik  TR41                      1742                1703
 8 Erzurum, Erzincan, Bayburt TRA1                       377                 362
 9 Gaziantep, Adıyaman, Kilis TRC1                       969                 949
10 Hatay, Kahramanmaraş, Osm… TR63                      1154                1127
# ℹ 16 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable:
#   `Hanehalkı Kullanılabilir Gelire Göre(Gini Katsayısı)` <dbl>

population$`Bölge 2 İd`<- ""
for (i in 1:nrow(population)) {
  city <- population$City[i]
  
  for (j in 1:length(region26$Bölge)) {
    if (grepl(city, region26$Bölge[j])) {
      population$`Bölge 2 İd`[i] <- paste(region26$`Bölge 2 İd`[j])
      break 
    }
  }
}
